org_name: SSM Health St. Mary's Hospital - Madison

request_pathways.name: SSM Health Hospitals fax (608-270-6815) or Dean Medical Group fax (608-294-6294)

forms.document_type: Request for access / ROI authorization form (system-wide)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient downloads a generic authorization-to-release form, writes 'self' in the recipient field, checks 'Personal Use,' and faxes or mails it to the Health Information Department.

red_flags: Fee language includes 'viewing' alongside copying â€” HIPAA does not permit charging patients for inspecting their own records
Sensitive categories (mental health, substance abuse, HIV/AIDS) default to inclusion unless patient explicitly excludes them
bright_spots: MyChart patient portal offered as a records delivery format option
Email and fax available as electronic delivery formats
Comprehensive patient rights information on back page with Wisconsin-specific minor consent rules
Photocopy validity clause removes friction for fax submission

findability.rationale: Level 4: Forms were easy to find with basic web searches and the SSM Health website has a 'Get My Medical Records' page; minor deduction for three overlapping forms with no guidance on which to use.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: The form has a text layer making digital annotation possible with workarounds, and fax submission is available; however, zero fillable fields means most patients will print and handwrite.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized numbered sections with logical flow and thorough back-page patient rights information; minor issues include dense opening legal paragraph and 'q' checkbox rendering.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the form by selecting 'Personal Use' and writing 'self' as recipient, but the form is fundamentally an authorization-to-release designed for third-party disclosure, not a patient access request form.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: No notarization or in-person requirements, but fee language mentioning charges for 'viewing' records may exceed HIPAA limits for patient access, and no 30-day response timeline is stated on the primary form.

overall.summary: SSM Health St. Mary's Madison provides easily findable forms with good delivery options including MyChart, but the generic authorization-form approach, lack of fillable fields, and questionable fee language prevent it from achieving a patient-centered experience.
